creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
This is a meta-bug to track protocol violations in httpd as a caching proxy.  Individual protocol violations will be made dependencies of this bug, so it will be fixed when all dependencies are fixed.

c.f. PR 43454, a similar report for mod_proxy without caching.

There are a few old bugs to enter as dependencies, but preliminary results from the coadvisor test suite indicate there will also be a number of new reports.
Why is bugzilla second-guessing my platform?  Most httpd bugs are platform-agnostic!
creator: nick@webthing.com

text:
entering initial list of coadvisor dependencies (if bugzilla accepts the list)
More to come!
creator: nick@webthing.com
minfrin@sharp.fm
text:
Turns out the HTTP violations above were not limited to mod_cache.

Closing out this ticket as all the child tickets are handled. The rest of the violations can be handled as adhoc bugs.
